[color=transparent]       [/color]

[align=center][url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=561239][img]https://hackforums.news/assets/v3/Headlines/iHydra.png[/img][/url][/align]

[b][color=white]GDPR Discussion[/color][/b]
Omniscient recently pushed out new policies so Hack Forums can be compliant with the newly launched GDPR. A thread was created as many started to question a few agreement points. If you do have any questions or wanted to read through the pages, head on over to that thread to read more.[i][size=x-small][url=https://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5853729] >>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]4 New Donation Awards[/color][/b]
Four new donation awards have been added, each going for $25 and are giftable. All four are cryptocurrency related: Qtum, Waves, PivX, and Lisk.[i][size=x-small][url=https://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5854004] >>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]What's Prestige?[/color][/b]
Prestige is no longer a thing, that's what. A points system is in the works which will have a more meaningful use for the community unlike Prestige. Omniscient believes Prestige was dated and no longer of use to the forum.[i][size=x-small][url=https://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5853746] >>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]Contracts Required for Currency Exchange[/color][/b]
It is now a bannable offense to refuse/not use Contracts system when doing currency exchange. Currency Exchange threads must contain the Contracts MyCode. Read the thread for specific details.[i][size=x-small][url=https://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5852705] >>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[align=center][url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=3322334][img]https://i.imgur.com/H5MRIbN.png[/img][/url][/align]

[b][color=white]US Greenhouse Emissions are Higher Than we Thought[/color][/b] 
A new study pegs the United States' greenhouse gas emissions at nearly 60% higher than the Environmental Protection Agency stated. This study points out that previously thought "clean" gasses may not be as good for the planet as we think. This study, conducted by the Environmental Defence Fund, also estimates the leakage of  US pipelines at almost double that of the EPA's percentage. Steven Hamburg, a co-author of the paper, says "this is by far the most comprehensive body of research of its kind." This study certainly seems to warrant further research into our prolonged effects on the environment.  [i][size=x-small][url=https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/nation/2018/06/21/emissions-greenhouse-gas-methane-higher-than-epa-thinks/722391002/]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]I Learned it From you![/color][/b] 
Emotional eating is one of the larger problems in our society. A recent study published in Pediatric Obesity suggests that there is almost zero correlation between it and genetics. Instead, the study claims that young ones learn it by watching how their parents eat, or do not, during stressful situations. “Experiencing stress and negative emotions can have a different effect on appetite for different people. Some crave their favourite snack, whereas others lose their desire to eat altogether when feeling stressed or sad. This study supports our previous findings suggesting that children’s emotional over- and under-eating are mostly influenced by environmental factors completely shared by twin pairs and that genes are largely unimportant for emotional overeating in childhood." says Dr. Moritz Herle. [i][size=x-small][url=http://www.ucl.ac.uk/news/news-articles/0618/180618_emotional_eating]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[color=transparent]   [/color]

[align=center][img]https://i.imgur.com/lv4d7BY.png[/img][/align]

[b][color=white]2020 Tokyo Games to be fully powered by renewable energy, organizers say[/color][/b] 
During the 2020 Tokyo Games, the organizing committee aims to power the games using renewable energy, in an effort to pave the path of awareness for a more sustainable society. “All electricity used at all venues will be derived entirely from renewable energy sources, in order to promote decarbonization.” Additionally, the committee in charge intends to use leasing services for their power sources, that way “99 percent of the good procured for the games will be reused or recycled.” The renewable energy aims to target the powering of the “athletes’ village, the international broadcasting center and the main press center.” The renewable energy will be provided by power companies and the installation of solar panels. Though the price is a factor, the main intent of this decision is to cut back on fossil fuels and promote other forms of energy production. The vast majority of products will be rented and leased, however necessary purchases will be made. In regard to plastic bottles and leftover food, the committee aims to recycle at least 65% of all generated waste. The committee plans to execute another project involving the residents, “in addition to an ongoing initiative to create games medals out of metals collected from used mobile phones and other equipment.” The strive for such a [i]clean[/i] Games is to promote sustainability among the public and is ‘crucial to pass it on as a legacy,” “an official said.” [i][size=x-small][url=https://www.japantimes.co.jp/news/2018/06/22/national/2020-tokyo-games-fully-powered-renewable-energy-organizers-say/#.Wy2H-tn92Um]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]North Korea 'total denuclearization' started; officials see no new moves[/color][/b] 
On Thursday, 21 May 2018, President Trump released an official statement, where, in certainty, he provided a glimpse of progress inside of the North Korea-United States nuclear deal. He stated that they began progress, further explaining that the country “was blowing up four of its big test sites and that a process of ‘total denuclearization has already started,’ however, officials said that no such evidence has made itself apparent. At the Cabinet meeting, he further stated that ‘They’ve stopped the sending of missiles, including ballistic missiles. They’re destroying their engine site. They’re blowing it up. They’ve already blown up one of their big test sites, in fact it’s actually four of their big test sites.” Upon discussion, Cabinet members were unclear of which North Korean test sites President Trump was referring to, and according U.S. officials who are “familiar with current intelligence on North Korea’s nuclear and missile test sites,” there has been no evidence or movements to undergo the disabling or destruction of any sites since the meeting between the two leaders on 12 June. After continued discussions, the same official spoke on potential targets that Trump could have been referring to. Earlier in May, North Korea was said to have planned on destroying “tunnels at the Punggye-ri nuclear test site and the dismantling of a medium-range ballistic missile test stand at Iha-ri,” although it is not with certainty that this is what the president spoke in reference to.   [i][size=x-small][url=https://www.reuters.com/article/us-northkorea-usa-sites/trump-north-korea-total-denuclearization-started-officials-see-no-new-moves-idUSKBN1JH2QX?utm_source=reddit.com]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[color=transparent]   [/color][/size][/font]
